attributes.action: Make law to link all new vehicles' EMS to their Sat-Nav, to limit their speed.
attributes.background:
Vehicular Sat-Nav systems already receive data relating to the speed limit of a vehicle's location, and should be connected to each one's EMS, so it can automatically limit its speed.
• Emergency vehicles would be exempt (for obvious reasons)
• A criminal offence to circumvent the technology
attributes.additional_details: In 2013, the UK suffered 3,064 accidents attributable to speed, in which people were either killed or seriously injured. The technology now exists that can make the roads safer.

attributes.action: Make homework voluntary across all schools.
attributes.background: As it’s mental health awareness week, it got me thinking about how anxious I used to be when I did not complete my homework when I was a student. I used to make myself sick or just go AWOL at school. I see the same pattern occurring within my children’s behaviour.

attributes.action: Repeal Section 127 (1) of the 2003 Communications Act. Offence is not a crime.
attributes.background:
The Communications Act states: (1) A person is guilty of an offence if he 
(a) sends by means of a public electronic communications network a message or other matter that is GROSSLY OFFENSIVE or of an indecent, obscene or menacing character.
attributes.additional_details: Clearly, this is in breach of everybody's right to Freedom of Speech. Offence is an entirely subjective concept. For the state to be able to decide what is offensive, and then prosecute accordingly is tyrannical.

attributes.action: Stop insurance discrimination affecting those with pre existing medical issues
attributes.background: Our society (rightly) talks about equality and yet the Government accepts insurance companies charging people more money for taking out policies - if they have a pre existing medical condition. It's blatant prejudice and discrimination. The government must stop this insurance industry-led practice.
attributes.additional_details: The Government has said (in a letter to MP David Davies) that this is a commercial matter. Yet human rights are not a commercial matter. Life & CIC insurance is necessary for security. The Universal Declaration of Human Rights says: Article 25. (1) Everyone has the right to security in the event of unemployment, sickness, disability... in circumstances beyond his control. 'Everyone' includes people with pre existing medical conditions who cannot afford higher premiums for life/CIC insurance.

attributes.action: Continue the renewable energy 'feed in tariff' beyond March 2019.
attributes.background: The Feed in Tariff is the government scheme to provide reward for consumers who install renewable energy devices at home or business. This tariff pays people for the energy created and stimulates green energy growth. This scheme is due to expire in March 2019, we call for this to be continued.
attributes.additional_details:
The Feed in Tariff is the government scheme to provide reward for consumers for renewable energy production by paying people for the energy created and exported to the National Grid.

There are no plans to extend the Feed in Tariff beyond March 2019, which will remove any incentive for consumers to install renewable energy devices, as any energy created will simply flow to the National Grid, with no financial compensation.

We, the undersigned, call for this scheme to be continued.

attributes.action: Adjust child benefit so that the payments are higher for young children.
attributes.background: I believe young children are harder to support than older children and receive very little help.   Currently child benefit is the same through a child's life.   I believe child benefit should be larger when the child is under 4 and then decrease as they get to 5 and when they become a teenager.
attributes.additional_details:
When a child is over 3 years old parents get support with child care costs.   
https://www.gov.uk/help-with-childcare-costs/free-childcare-and-education-for-2-to-4-year-olds

When the child gets close to 5 years old it goes to school, which is a form of child care.
https://www.gov.uk/schools-admissions/applying

When a child becomes a teenager their work restrictions become more lenient:
https://www.gov.uk/child-employment/restrictions-on-child-employment

attributes.action: Make supermarkets STOP using plastic and start using more sustainable packaging
attributes.background: We have “12 years to limit climate change catastrophe” (IPPC) I cannot help but look around at these huge corporations that are constantly using up energy and plastic (creating what I can only imagine are vast amounts of waste) If we want to keep the world turning let’s DO something about it!!
attributes.additional_details: I know it’s not a quick fix issue but I think, even if just one corporation changed, a huge difference would be made. This discussion needs to continue and has to evolve into actions if the situation is going to get any better. People need to be educated into the importance of recycling and how it is to be carried out because, I know it’s hard to believe, but some people have no idea what can and can’t be recycled! Please help change occur and sign this petition to start conversations and action

attributes.action: Make it illegal for single-use plastic to be visible or used in TV Advertising.
attributes.background: By removing single use plastic from view, we will decrease its popularity. It will no longer be a novelty to buy coffee in a "fashionable" plastic cup. Instead, bringing your own reuseable cup will become popular. This will force companies using single-use plastics to find a safe alternative.
attributes.additional_details:
We have no time to waste and the battle against plastic must be addressed from all angles. This is a serious threat to our planet,

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-45775309

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-36882799

Please help me do this.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for male toilets to have baby change facilities.
attributes.background: I believe that, unless there is a ‘baby changing room’ already allocated, there should be changing facilities in all female AND male bathrooms.
attributes.additional_details: I am tired of visiting family restaurants and being the only adult able to change our baby! I am yet to see baby changing facilities in male bathrooms and it makes life for my husband difficult and especially restricting when he is alone with the children. I also wonder how it must make male, same sex couples feel as parents when neither can visit the ladies bathroom.

attributes.action: Demand the Government clarify the legal status of Windrush Generation
attributes.background: The British Nationality Act 1948 created the status of  "Citizen of the United Kingdom and Colonies" allowing the Windrush Generation to stay in the UK as Citizens, if their status has changed please clarify which act changed this, if not publicly state the Windrush Generation are all citizens.
attributes.additional_details:
Relevant legislation is as follows:
Summary of British Nationality act 1948 - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/British_Nationality_Act_1948
Summary of Commonwealth immigration act 1962 -https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commonwealth_Immigrants_Act_1962
Summary of Commonwealth immigration act 1968 -https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commonwealth_Immigrants_Act_1968
Summary of Immigration Act 1971 - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Immigration_Act_1971

attributes.action: Shale gas to guarantee no costs to taxpayers or impact on aquifers.
attributes.background: No subsidies, no research funds. More people in the UK oppose fracking than support it. Taxpayers do not want taxes spent on assisting or supporting shale gas extraction. All the costs of shale exploration and extraction must come from the companies not the taxpayer.
attributes.additional_details: Costs to be measured and paid for include: noise abatement; air quality compensation; replacing damaged aquifers with access to undamaged aquifers; subsidence and seismic damage restoration; and policing. Costs must be covered in full costs before permission for any exploration or extraction is given. Money would be better spent helping protect water supplies in droughts, preventing flooding in storms, and improving NHS and care services.
attributes.creator_name: Catherine Ann Phillips CEnv CEng FIMECHE CMIOSH PIEMA MSc BEng (Hons) PGCert

attributes.action: Review the way interest is added to student loans.
attributes.background: Many young people will never afford to pay back their student loan.  Not only does the current system saddle young people with debt, it is not good for their mental health to know the loan is being added to monthly. The proposal here is to review the student loan interest system.
attributes.additional_details: Reducing interest rates, to be in line with the current Bank of England interest rate plus running cost of a non profit making company, seems to be a much better prospect for young people. The government will have to pick up the bill for any remaining loan, once the student is 53 years old. Let’s make a system work where young people can realistically pay their loans off or a system where the government subsidises all loans.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for all red processed meat to carry government health warning
attributes.background:
Back in 2015 the World Health Organisation classified red processed meat as carcinogenic. A group 1 carcinogen known cause cancer. The same category as tabaccco, arsenic and plutonium.
To date the Government has not acted responsibly and failed to make this information widely known to the public.
attributes.additional_details:
We ask for an extensive campaign to infrom the public of the health risks carried by red processed meat products. We expect the government to act responsibly by making it mandatory to include a health warning on the packing of all processed meat products and to ensure the health of our children by removing all processed meat products from the menu within schools and hospitals.

Link to the World Health Organisation on processed meat: 
http://www.who.int/features/qa/cancer-red-meat/en/

attributes.action: Change Marriage Allowance to include cohabiting couples
attributes.background:
Marriage Allowance lets you transfer £1,190 of your Personal Allowance to your husband, wife or civil partner - if they earn more than you.

This reduces their tax by up to £238 in the tax year (6 April to 5 April the next year).
attributes.additional_details: Cohabiting couples are viewed as a married couple for the sake of government benefits, household income and in some cases of possession (entitlement to mortgaged house).

attributes.action: Automatic general election on change in the leadership of the governing party.
attributes.background: Given the substantial change in the character of a political party on changing its leadership, it seems undemocratic for the mandate from a general election to automatically transfer to a new leader with potentially completely different policies without consulting the electorate.
attributes.additional_details: The law should be changed to require a General Election if the leadership of the governing party changes.

attributes.action: Utility companies to move elderly customers onto the cheapest available tariff.
attributes.background: Many elderly citizens are paying excessive amounts for gas, electricity and water. Make it law that utility companies must automatically place them on their cheapest available contracts at the time of renewal, not just place them on a standard expensive tariff.
attributes.additional_details: Utility markets are a competitive marketplace, and rightly so. Contract renewals are generally based around internet "Compare" websites that many elderly do not understand how to use. Electric and Gas suppliers are exploiting this fact by not moving them onto the best contract at renewal time. This is wrong and should be legislated against.

attributes.action: The UK Government to support a joint British bid for the 2030 world cup
attributes.background: Britain has shown itself to be a nation that unites when it comes to sport. In these somewhat divided times a post-Brexit United Kingdom will need to find ways to unite us all and demonstrate that we are outward facing nation. What better way that a joint bid to host the football World Cup?
attributes.additional_details: The English FA mounted an unsuccessful bid to host the recent 2018 World Cup that was awarded to Russia. Whilst there is no doubt that England has the footballing infrastructure to host the tournament the world cup has of course been held in England once before in 1966 and a joint British bid would be something new with the added dimensions of all home nations then qualifying as hosts. As well as Wembley and other English stadia games could be played at Principality and Hampden Park.

attributes.action: Set up a Citizens' Assembly for public engagement at Parliament
attributes.background:
Public Engagement is seen to be in distress, with a feeling of disconnect and distrust between voters and House of Commons

We ask that a representative sample of the electorate is invited with remuneration to engage with issues and MPs at Parliament, and make recommendations on current affairs
attributes.additional_details:
Citizens' Assembly Ireland: https://www.citizensassembly.ie/en/

Sortition Foundation: https://www.sortitionfoundation.org/what_is_sortition

Lecture by Prof. James Fishkin: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=27tVMj6YUNM

FT article on David Van Reybrouck: https://www.ft.com/content/03f34228-4e72-11e6-8172-e39ecd3b86fc

attributes.action: Ban the sale of single-use, portable BBQs
attributes.background: Disposable single-use BBQs encourage people into the countryside during good weather but recent coverage of large scale moorland fires this year illustrates their incompatibility with responsible countryside use. Using BBQ in hot, dry weather is simply not worth the risk to nature, property or life.
attributes.additional_details: This summer's significant national media coverage of moorland wildfires across the UK

attributes.action: More equality for owner occupiers in claims for support for mortgage interest
attributes.background: When people make a claim within universal credit for help with owner occupier housing costs (support for mortgage interest) there is a 39 week wait, 9 assessment periods. Also if they earn even 1 penny they cannot receive any help. Any help they do get is now a loan.
attributes.additional_details: This is inconsistent with support for tenants. The housing element for rental costs can be paid within weeks and people are allowed to work and still get the support. Before transferring to universal credit people could get help with mortgage interest and still do permitted work whilst receiving employment and support allowance, for example. https://www.gov.uk/support-for-mortgage-interest; https://www.gov.uk/housing-and-universal-credit

attributes.action: Ban Smart Meters
attributes.background: There have been concerns about their effect on people’s health, along with the way that they could invade your privacy, and in the end they cost way more compared to an old type of meter.

attributes.action: Provide special constables with a right to time off work to undertake duties
attributes.background: There is no right to unpaid time off work to undertake duties as a special constable.  Other public duties benefit from this right such as magistrates and council members. Special constables patrol side by side with paid police officers undertaking the same duties and tasks but on a voluntary basis.
attributes.additional_details:
Section 50(1) of the Employment Rights Act 1996 provides:

"An employer shall permit an employee of his who is a justice of the peace to take time off during the employee’s working hours for the purpose of performing any of the duties of his office."

The petitioner proposes a simple amendment to the Act:  after "justice of the peace" insert "or a special constable".  This would provide recognition to thousands of special constables in the country, providing them with the right to undertake their duties.

attributes.action: Require Parliamentary Approval before Ratifying Treaties or MOUs
attributes.background:
An Act of Parliament is required which provides that: 
a. Ratification is no longer a prerogative power 
b. the treaty text must be laid before parliament for 3 months 
c. an order to ratify must then be laid under affirmative procedure whereby both houses have to vote yes, or it fails.
attributes.additional_details: Allowing ratification without thorough parliamentary scrutiny and the final say surely weakens the hand of the UK negotiators. I believe that the only rational motive for Dr Fox being allowed to ratify the deal with the US unchallenged would be to allow him to do something that the British public would not approve of, e.g. to hasten the destruction of the NHS.

attributes.action: Allegations of workplace bullying against John Bercow should be investigated.
attributes.background: John Bercow, the Speaker of the House of Commons, has been accused of workplace bullying. MPs have rejected the proposal of an investigation into these claims.  The accusations against the Speaker need to be investigated. Those elected to the House of Commons must be accountable for their behaviour.

attributes.action: Devolve the suburban rail services in London to Transport for London.
attributes.background: The suburban railways in and around London that are operated by private companies are in a bad state with delays, cancellations and general bad quality of service. TfL operated services are some of the most reliable services in the country and have seen significant improvements since TfL took over.
attributes.additional_details:
TfL's plans for devolution released back in 2016 but rejected by the DfT, seemingly for no reason at all: https://tfl.gov.uk/corporate/about-tfl/how-we-work/planning-for-the-future/developing-the-rail-network
Chris Grayling's letter to Boris Johnson detailing how he was putting politics over devolution of service in London: https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2016/dec/07/chris-grayling-accused-of-putting-politics-over-people-in-rail-letter-leak

attributes.action: Initiate a Royal Commission examining Policing in the UK
attributes.background: Policing in the UK appears to be at crisis point- the last Royal Commision on Policing was held in 1962, over half a century ago. The policing landscape has significantly evolved in 56 years, and a review of policing practice in the UK is long overdue.

attributes.action: Invest at least 1% of the new Digital Tech Tax to tackle online abuse!
attributes.background: Sexism, harassment and abuse happens both on and offline. It also disproportionately affects and silences women. It is time the government took this problem seriously. It is time law enforcement caught up with online crime and time tech companies delivered real support to the users they profit from.
attributes.additional_details:
On 29 October the Chancellor announced a new digital tech tax on companies like Facebook and Twitter. We are calling for at least an annual 1% to be spent on:

1) The £200,000 that the Home Secretary announced in 2017 to spend on a UK Hate Crime Hub
2) Public education campaigns on online abuse
3) Increase police resources and capacity to adequately investigate and prosecute online abuse
4) Pilot an e-Safety Commissioner focused on e-safety of women and girls and ending online abuse

attributes.action: Improve the assessment element of Personal Independence Payment
attributes.background:
Assessors training and knowledge is too generalised.
A common complaint with PIP assessments is that assessors cannot be trusted to record accurately what took place during the assessment.
Assessors also deal with a wide range of conditions and are not specialist to each individual condition.
attributes.additional_details: https://publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm201719/cmselect/cmworpen/829/82906.htm

attributes.action: Raise awareness of early cancer symptoms among GPs
attributes.background: After recent family dealings with cancer and previous friends I have known dying from cancer it was evident that the GP's involved were at a loss to diagnose what was happening which may have contributed to the disease not being treated early enough resulting in prolonged suffering.
attributes.additional_details: The Government should provide more training on the symptoms and tests that can spot cancer early.

attributes.action: Urge the USA not to adopt “Title IX”
attributes.background: The policy, Title IX, would effectively define Transgenderism out of the law. It states that sex is the only determining factor in gender and that it can’t be changed. By suggesting this, the White House would be removing all protections for transgender Americans or individuals who live or visit.
attributes.additional_details: This is not a British issue yet, it is vital that we set up and shut this down. By introducing this policy America becomes an affront to not just LGBT+ rights, but to human rights. Trans rights are human rights and we, the United Kingdom and Europe, have an honourable and proud tradition of guarding these rights and sharing them around the world. If one of our closest trading partners and allies can introduce something like Title IX, and we don’t stop them, then where does that put us?

attributes.action: Seek agreement to extend Article 50 period by one year to achieve best possible
attributes.background: With the government in crisis and running out of time to negotiate a Brexit deal, article 50 must be extended. If the U.K. is to get a good deal, we will need more time. Therefore, Article 50 must be extended to March 29th, 2020 or we risk a catastrophe.

attributes.action: Remove the Variable Speed limits from the motorways & remove all speed cameras
attributes.background: I have investigated the new emerging smart motorways across the UK and their use of variable speed limits & legend signs. I believe they are being misused and are causing a nuisance to drivers. The new system does not work, is chaotic & has major fallacies. The law harms innocent drivers.
attributes.additional_details: I have gathered a massive volume of evidence specifically in researching & investigating the Police, Highways & Council departments for required work I needed to perform for this petition. The work is conducted & directed by me in support of my right to petition."

attributes.action: Require bookmakers to give the same offers to shop and internet customers.
attributes.background: Bookmakers have promotional offers that are only available to online customers. These should be available in shops. A lot of older people have been using shops since the early sixties, these people are not computer literate and they are being denied the offers that online account customers receive.

attributes.action: Anything plastic must be made with a minimum of 50% recycled material by 2022
attributes.background: We the UK public demand plastic manufacturers take responsibility for the problem created by plastic and that the government regulate this as soon as possible

attributes.action: Reduce the drink-drive limit to 0.05, reducing it to 0.02 in a few years
attributes.background: I was watching Trust me I'm a Doctor on the BBC and the drink drive limit has not been altered since inception in 1967, despite science moving on. When it was set at 0.08, it was believed this doubled the risk of a fatal collision, it is now known to be 13 times higher.
attributes.additional_details: Road safety expert Professor Richard Allsopp, who set the original limit, states that he would now not choose that limit. He recommends a reduction to 0.05 (the same as Scotland), reducing to 0.02 in a few years (the same as the rest of Europe). He estimated that the reduction to 0.05 would save 25 lives a year. I want the Ministry of Transport to implement this and accept that the limit is currently far too high for safety. Ours is one of the highest blood alcohol limits in the world.

attributes.action: Make weekly classes  in schools about the cruel affects of bullying compulsory
attributes.background:
I am hearing all too often of children taking their own lives due to the cruel bullies making their lives a mystery.
I was bullied myself in school over 20 years ago and am shocked more hasn't been done to try to prevent it.

attributes.action: Prevent housing associations from charging tennents for essential tree work.
attributes.background: A family member of mine who lives in a housing association house had a dangerous tree in their garden. The Housing Association wanted to charge them more than £2000 to carry out the work needed to make the tree safe. I complained and won, but they continued to implement this unfair policy on others.
attributes.additional_details: Housing associations are using a loophole in the law designed for private tenants to include tree work as "standard maintenance" (along with changing bulbs) in their tenancy agreement. As the owner of the property, and therefore the tree, the housing association should be held liable for any risk posed by dangerous trees in their tenant's gardens. So forcing the tenants to pay for tree work to mitigate the risk that they (the tenant) are not responsible for is unfair and should be made illegal.

attributes.action: Give nurses a better pay deal
attributes.background: Many nurses have been misled over how much they would receive as the result of the recent pay deal. Nurses had been told that they would get  least an immediate 3% pay rise but this is not what happened.
attributes.additional_details: Nurses were expecting a long-awaited and well-deserved pay rise but instead have been left disappointed and out of pocket.

attributes.action: Ban public smoking outside of designated smoking areas.
attributes.background: After seeing and experiencing secondhand smoke in public and having not chosen to experience secondhand smoke I believe smokers should be obligated to not expose others to smoke. If violated an appropriate fine should be given to offenders.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.cancerresearchuk.org/about-cancer/causes-of-cancer/smoking-and-cancer/passive-smoking

https://www.cdc.gov/tobacco/data_statistics/fact_sheets/secondhand_smoke/health_effects/index.htm

https://www.nhs.uk/smokefree/why-quit/secondhand-smoke

attributes.action: Extend support available for care leavers doing apprenticeships beyond 24 years
attributes.background: Having worked within social care with children and families for 19 years it has saddened me that the prospects for care leavers aren't very positive. They need additional support and mentoring to access meaningful employment and often aren't ready to do this before 24 years old like their peers.
attributes.additional_details: Through maintaining contact with some care leavers I see a huge gap in supporting them appropriately into employment so that they will become financially independent and improve their personal well being in all areas. They need additional support and mentoring due the gaps and disadvantages their backgrounds have created and usually beyond the age of their peers without disadvantages. The new support available should have no upper age limit for care leavers.

attributes.action: Create a new Ministerial Department called the Department For a Fair Society.
attributes.background:
New technologies could benefit everyone but instead, they are often exploited for maximum corporate profit 
The DFFS should: 
a) Find and support technologies that can have a revolutionary positive impact on society
b) Champion them to other government departments, the press and business groups
attributes.additional_details:
Technology already exists that can break the vicious circle of poverty, give fair access to top quality education and healthcare, and end the exploitation of vulnerable people by unscrupulous business. Instead of trying to fix our broken economy, these technologies could be harnessed to create a new, ethical model that will not favour the rich over the poor or any other group over another.
The DFFS would lead the country, and the rest of the world, to a fairer, more inclusive model for society.

attributes.action: Set a legal limit on the acceptable temperature for public transport of humans
attributes.background: With death tolls in Japan this week because of soaring temperatures doesn’t the UK government think it is important to set a legal limit on what is an acceptable temperature for the public transport of humans.
attributes.additional_details: People in the UK have had to endure temperatures on the Central Line, Northern Line and from other rail operators in excess of 40 degrees. This temperature is above the legal limit for the transport of cattle and other animals, why should we as humans be any worse off. I ask the UK government to act swiftly, invest properly with Air con installation throughout all networks and bottled water provided free to all passengers during Summer months.

attributes.action: Scrap the current school grading system and give us a result out of 100 (%).
attributes.background: Every year we get exam and test results for our children that are seemingly meaningless. The results don't tell us how much of the subject material they have actually learnt. If your child achieves a level 4C in Science, how much of the curriculum do they really know? Half? Three quarters? Who knows
attributes.additional_details: I propose two things: 1) that all tests are graded out of 100% and 2) that individual targets are scrapped. By giving us parents a simple percentage, you will be able to easily see how much of the subject your child actually knows. If they get a result of 65%, you can then decide if that's good enough for their ability or if you want them to work toward a higher grade.

attributes.action: Require drivers over the age of 65 to retake their driving test
attributes.background: As people get older, their reaction times may slow down and their vision may become impaired.

attributes.action: Replace the compulsory subject of RE for basic level psychology and counselling.
attributes.background: We are in the middle of a mental health revolution. The world of psychology is making advances and stigmas are being broken down in society. Mental health effects everybody either directly or indirectly and it is our duty to make sure children are given the tools needed to deal with these issues.
attributes.additional_details: In our modern day of technology wasting precious educational time and taxpayers money to teach religion is outdated. Any teenager has access to the internet where they can learn about any religion to their hearts content. Instead with this time we can introduce teens to basic level psychology. To get children asking questions, growing their knowledge on issues and learning how to deal them. Many time it takes humans a while to learn about themselves so the more headstart we can give the better.

attributes.action: Make medical insurance compulsory for foreign nationals visiting the UK.
attributes.background: When visiting a foreign country, UK citizens are required to take out travel / medical insurance. This should be made compulsory for foreign nationals. This could save millions of pounds for the NHS.

attributes.action: Raise Firefighters' wages to a reasonable living wage (+ all emergency services)
attributes.background: The fire fighters are real life heroes risking their own life and limb, running into danger, for the sake of others and their property. Their wages, along with ALL other emergency service workers, have been frozen and capped instead of being given the recognition they deserve.
attributes.additional_details:
Statement of a firefighter: “Personally I go to work to earn money to provide for my family and myself.  In my mind all public services work extremely hard (Police, Fire, Ambulance or our nurses and doctors).  Our pay was frozen, then capped at 1% whilst inflation has risen at about 3%, our pension contributions have risen and the NI contributions we pay so, in effect, our wages have dropped.” 

ALL emergency services deserve a decent living wage and appropriate funding for volunteer agencies.

attributes.action: Impose a term limit on all MPs of 10 years (no limit on election cycles)
attributes.background: Over the past 30 years, a political class has developed of people who know nothing but politics. They have never done a real job or worked in the private sector. After University they become bag carriers, SPADs and then MPs. They live in a bubble and do not understand concerns.
attributes.additional_details: A term limit of 10 years - irrespective of the number of general elections - would give an MP enough time to learn the ropes of Westminster and be able to make a contribution to society and their constituency. It would increase the turnover and mean that they could not make this their sole career. More people would be able to participate, reduce hostility/apathy toward UK politics and people with a more varied life experience other than life in politics would get a voice in parliament.

attributes.action: Mobility scooters users should be licenced, insured and pass a handling test.
attributes.background: To help prevent more members of the general public being injured, as i was recently, by one of these large, heavy, unregulated vehicles driven without due care in public places.

attributes.action: Ban Smacking In England
attributes.background: Smacking isn’t needed and many times it has been proven by specialists that smacking isn’t needed to correct bad behavior. It’s time to ban it and humanely educate our kids to behave without hitting them.
